text: Food is ok, average, drinks are not that great. Prices are high. Service if OK as well. Save your time and find other place to eat.
I am very full.....the food was great, the customer service was outstanding Alfredo was our waiter and he was super nice!!! The atmosphere is amazing the murals are gorgeous.

This new local Mexican restaurant, Fiesta Mexicana is great. Drinks are on point, up at the bar. Alan, was also great in preparing our tableside guacamole. Definitely personalized our first impression here at Fiesta.
Just opened last week. Found it by accident. Margaritas are not for sissies. Great food and service. Atmosphere is authentic. Great place and we'll be back.

Had the misfortune of spending almost three hours at this place last night. We went there for an uncle's birthday dinner. This was our first and last visit. We have four small kids who need to eat fairly quickly so they won't get hungry, irritable and restless. 

We ordered a kid's water and they brought out an adult-sized water. I never received the water i had requested. My wife's margarita was lacking any tequila.
We asked for bean dip and we are told they don't serve bean dip. 

The server was nice enough but his service was confused, disorganized and infrequent.
This place is slower than the second coming of Christ. We sat down at 7:00, had to send out a search party to get our checks so we could leave after 9:30. We had a large party of 17 at our tables. We were one of the first to order and were the last to receive our cold food two hours later. We ordered food for our little ones which was also served cold two hours later. My wife and I ordered the steak fajitas for 2 which is way overpriced at $28.99. 

The waiter actually told us that they serve the food on individual tickets at the same time so everyone at our table ate at different times and not together. Another couple in our party ordered chicken fajitas for two which came out hot, smoking and sizzling. Our steak fajitas came out with no sizzle, no smoke and no heat. I actually said something to the waiter about our fajitas not sizzling and he smiled stupidly and said the cast iron pan is still hot. The waiter didnt offer to go back and bring us sizzling steak fajitas. The cold fajitas were tasteless and the steak was rubbery and congealed.

The food is crappy and overpriced. That combined with the indifferent service means you'd be well-advised not to waste any of your hard-earned money at this dump.

This Mexican restaurant is very average. I've had dinner twice at this restaurant with my friend and my husband and the food was nothing special. 
The positive: the margaritas, the service 
The negative: smallest burrito I've ever seen, rice and beans are unimpressive, all in all none of us said "I'll definitely order that again" either time we visited
Another great visit, and the food was fantastic!  Our waiter, Alfredo, was exceptional!!! The best place to come for Mexican food!

The interior is welcoming and very festive.  The staff is very attentive!  The lunch menu has some good options for $10 or less.  I declined the chips and salsa as they didn't look to be fresh made like other local restaurants.  The food is average (I had the shredded beef flauta, rice and beans).  The flavor of the beef was nice.  The sides were very unmemorable.  I also had a cup of the traditional noodle soup.  I was thrown off by the carrots and the cheese in it. The overall flavor minus the surprises was really good.

Do I really have to give a star? Terrible service...and by terrible I mean zero service. Can't tell you about the food because, well, no one served us. There were about 25 servers standing around and NO ONE acknowledged us. It's obvious, I would not recommend this place.
This place it's amazing, food was very good.. our server was very attentive. We will definitely comeback ..I really like the atmosphere and the decorations

If you want to try real authentic Mexican food this is the place to go! From the moment we walk in everything is very clean and the staff is extremely friendly and helpful. 
I loved the decorations and the hand carved and painted furniture as well as the music.When it came to the food it was amazing and tasted awesome. No one complained the food or appetizers and everything was very well cooked l

This is not AUTHENTIC MEXICANA FOOD! My sister and I were so hungry we saw this place checked the reviews on google and the have 4.6 stars, how?  You do not use frozen vegetables in a dish or with a De Cameron Chile rellenos. The shrimp is small and the prices are ridiculous! It's not on or really near the strip so to have prices like that, I'm positive they will not survive and the atmosphere is mediocre. The hostess lied to us when we walked in and told us the food was good of-course. They tried to over charge us and then when I didn't like the dish the raves do much about, nor did my sister, I asked for 2 shrimp tacos and got 2 of them with 4 little shrimp in a flour tortilla and then have the nerve to charge $16.50 for that! The food is nasty, the chef needs to go back to school...but the bartender was super chill. I tipped her and after disputing the check with the Manager Caesar, he still was trying to make us pay $60 bucks! Not worth the time or money! I give it 2 stars because of the bartender only!  Really it's only worth no stars! 
Never AGAIN. Don't waste your time here, seriously. Go to Bonita Michoacan it's way better and it's authentic!!!!
this place is  awesome 100 % recommended all the people is great JESUS  was so friendly  the food is very good

Went and had lunch here today after my daughter and her family went yesterday. I walked in and immediately got a smile on my face. Very clean,bright and fun. The service was amazing and so was the food. Prices were good, I was so impressed and will defiantly go back. I highly recommend you give this place a try. You won't be sorry you did.

Wayyy too expensive for what you get. They load the plate up with refried beans and rice and too small of the actual meal. They load the rice and beans to make the plate look big. Taste dont care much for. Not real mexican food. Very disappointed. Far too expensive. Service was not bad
This is my new favorite Mexican restaurant the food was awesome and big portion, Ivy our waiter was on it.
Love the Cadillac Margarita! Ordered the Burrito Acapulco! Incredible furnishings all imported from Mexico. Table side guacamole was muy delicioso!

First time here with my girlfriend had a standard and Original Mexican food just standard burritos very good service was great servers name was Allen I would recommend him to anyone The Establishment is very clean and Lively

Enjoyed our dinner experience last night at this new-to-Las Vegas Mexican restaurant.   The decor is fun and festive, the wait staff professional, friendly and helpful.  Our waiter, Alan, was amazingly solicitous. Dan loved his Cadillac Margarita while I sipped on a delicious Sangria. The menu was outstanding, offering many choices for breakfast, appetizers, lunch, dinner and dessert.  We tried combo dinners in order to sample a variety of menu items.  No disappointments! We will be joining the Grand Opening festivities on Sunday, June 11th. Come enjoy great, authentic Mexican food with 1/2-priced entrees on Sunday. See you there!

I am so happy this place is across the street from me. So so good! The salsa is amazing, nice and spicy. The service was great! Cesar our server was prompt and attentive. This will be my new date night spot, so there goes my diet.

This place is awesome , great service great attitude, and most of all they are always happy  to see you as they greet everyone with a huge smile as you come through the doors.

 Sometimes there are mistakes made but then again no one  is perfect !!! and if you haven't tried the this restaurant I strongly suggest you give it a go !!!!!!

Husband and I brought my mother to this restaurant we wanted to treat her to something nice and good . Sadly our experience wasn't nice or good . Yes this restaurant is very nice inside . I love the decorations. But having nice decorations does not mean the food will be good . What's the point of a nice place when the food taste awful . My mom ordered the chicken mole plate , mole was not from scratch it tasted more like it was from the Do√±a Maria , The chicken was not fully cooked . Which thankfully she didn't get sense she ate most of it . My Husband ordered the wet burrito he said it was okay nothing extremely bad about it . My soon ordered some nachos witch had more beans then carne asada on them . Also what makes nachos "NACHOS" is cheese don't be greedy with the cheese . 
My 18 month old had a sopa de fideo with no fideo in it only the broth , I did ask the server for a new one and showed him the soup . I ordered my self a disgusting Pollo A La Crema . Do Not Order this ! The chicken was not fully cooked it was still raw . The cream was not even seasoned at all it was just the cream no taste what so ever . I can say the only good thing was the rice and drinks that's it . I did tell the server and showed him the chicken he took it back offered for a new . I did not get a new one due to I was grossed out and couldn't eat any more . I do want to say that the server was very nice and he did attend to us . Sadly I will never return to this restaurant.

Probably one of the worst places I have been for service. The server or the kitchen one lost our ticket while waiting with a young child for over 45 mins. We asked for chips several times and never brought them back to us. We finally got up to ask for napkins and another drink and our server was sitting down eating. Btw...the place to was empty. The food was also mediocre at best when we finally received it. We also paid for the full meal and left a tip but will never be back!
I had the chimichanga with rice and beans excellent shredded beef. My daughter had the chicken enchiladas rice and beans hers was excellent too Great service

Came in after work wanting to eat some fast Mexican food saw this place came right in. After waiting for like 5 minutes waiter comes in ask if we want drinks. 10 minutes they bring chips and salsa. Food was really good! Service is ok. The decor is absolutely gorgeous and the ambiance is pretty good too with music playing. Big portions of food it your typical Mexican food but somewhat Americanized yet good. Cadillac margaritas and micheladas are a must!

This is my go to Mexican restaurant. Prices are quite reasonable and the food is always delicious. I always get the make your own combo plate. My only suggestion would of be to offer a cilantro free salsa as some people really despise it. But I haven't found a Mexican place anywhere that offers that.

Way over priced!!! I have no idea what the owner is thinking to price mediocre Mexican food at gourmet prices especially when there is Mexican restaurants in the area serving better food at more than half the price. I don't see this place being open very long. I mean 16 dollars for a Carne Asada burrito.....WOW
Lovely place,Mayra has taken well care off me and my friends!! I always feel special around her!!!!

This place deserves a review because it was freaking awesome.  If you're considering eating here please do.  You will not regret it. I ordered the chicken fajitas and strawberry margarita.  The chips and salsa were fresh. I wish I had a photo of the chicken fajitas.  This is my new favorite Mexican restaurant in Vegas
Where do I start! The food is great and reasonably priced! The drinks are very good! I had the long island margarita. And the waitresses are very pretty! 3 awesome things in one place! 5 stars!
The food server was nice the food was good but kind of pricey. The bartender did something I really don't like I won't say what but it is completely out of line.

My husband and I went here for the first time yesterday and all I have to say is we will go regularly from here on out! The customer service was exceptional and the food was impeccable! Great place!

Rebecca Hamm

The enchiladas are great, the tacos are great, but what I really love is the chips and salsa.  I've had three different kinds there and they were all good.  They all have heat on them, so be prepared for that, but I love it spicy, so it was all good.  The food was not spicy, which was good for my wife.  They have taco Tuesdays where you can get three tacos for $7.99.  We had the carne asada and al pastor, all very tasty.  They also have Enchilada Mondays, which is all you can eat enchiladas for $12.99. Everyone there is very friendly and the service is good except for one minor detail.  If you ask for something, a high chair, napkins, anything, it seems to take awhile to get it.  Perhaps they were busy, or perhaps it's because we were located far from the kitchen, but whatever the reason it would take a few minutes for something that should only take 30 seconds at other restaurants.  However, I'm not docking a star for that because even though there was a wait, we never had to remind them.  I've been to many restaurant where you're waiting and waiting and it's obvious the waiter forgot.  These guys leave and they don't come back until they have what you asked for, which is why I think it's just a matter of distance or something. Anyways, I highly recommend Fiesta Mexicana.  They have tv's for football games all over the restaurant.  The atmosphere is bright and friendly.  The staff is attentive and welcoming.  But, most important, the food is very good.
I love the Cadillac Margarita and the variety of dishes makes everyone happy! It's a little pricey, but worthwhile for a special occasion.

So i feel maybe I owe myself an apology (But not really) because maybe this is a chain mexican restaurant and I should have gone out for my first mexican taste for something more authentic. But I really enjoyed this: the chicken quesadilla was so good. I was so full I drifted off into the oven-hot night to find a place to rest. It was so tasty, and good service too! Half-price margaritas after 9 till close (10?)

THE GOOD: Interior is very nicely decorated, with traditional art and hand-painted booths. It's really is quite nice and sets a festive but casual ambiance. The service is also extremely attentive and the menu is massive. Portions are decently sized. 

THE NOT SO GOOD: If you think $16 for a burrito and $8 for a side salad is reasonable then you probably won't have a problem with this place but I found the dinner menu ridiculously overpriced. Weekday lunch specials from 11AM-3PM are around $10/person, and I can understand pricing for some of their specialty dishes but they need to do some serious adjustments or they won't be around long. 

THE FOOD: Hit or miss for our meals. Chips and salsa were fresh but a crispy beef taco was extremely basic and the meat had no flavor. Combo with chile relleno and a chicken enchilada was okay but not great. I'd come back to try their enchiladas suizas or happy hour for a margarita, but the food isn't good enough to warrant what they're charging. I would not come back for dinner pricing.

This place is great! Always come here at least once a week with my wife.. food is full of flavor.. prices aren't too bad.. service is amazing.. we always leave here more stuffed than a thanksgiving turkey and a smile on our faces.. we'll continue to come here.. read some other reviews and was surprised to see some 1 stars..

I have been here twice now, for "date night" with the wife. This place is taking over our old Mexican restaurant we used to go to. The atmosphere is unparalleled, If you like upbeat, this is it. they have a guacamole guy, and a mariachi band. Who cares if the corn maze for their tortillas didn't travel across the sonora desert by burro. the food tastes great the staff is happy, and it is by far the cleanest Mex restaurant I have been in.

The food here is OK at best. The presentation is mediocre, but could be considered a generous amount of food. The service here is positive but today I experienced something I am not fond of. The warmness of the service decreased immediately after receiving the check; which was not asked for! Any request that we had after was almost ignored despite having a friend join or table who decided it was best to go elsewhere after the horrible greeting/accommodation. This does not make it a bad place but my experience was not good.

Celebrated Cinco de Mayo here yesterday..I was excited to try a new (to me) Mexican restaurant that claims to be authentic but I ended up being super disappointed :( Service was good and the horchata was well made but the food was simply not authentic. I should have known it wasn't going to be what I expected when the menu offered items like "Mexican Pizza" .. there's no such thing lol I ordered the queso fundido which ended up being something off of a Taco Bell menu! I swear! I just had high expectations maybe .. I mean besides the carpeted floor.. the restaurant is appealing to the eye (colorful.. very stereotypical but fun?) and it also could be targeted to a different crowd so I can understand that but being Mexican myself I can say this place does not come close to its advertisement. This is not authentic Mexican food.

Since they opened here in Vegas, this has become my favorite Mexican restaurant.  I have eaten here multiple times.  I come a lot for their lunch specials.  I am always greeted at the door.  The staff is courteous and welcoming.  I love the decor which is very festive.  I have not had a bad meal and I have tried several different combos.  Everything here is delicious and the service is awesome.  I will continue to come to Fiesta Mexicana to fulfill my Mexican cravings.

This is my favorite of the 4-5 sit down Mexican restaurants within a few miles.  Went with a friend the other day and he's not a fan of Mexican.  The server took the time to bring him really spicy salsa on his request.  Since he wasn't a big Mexican food fan, the server was really nice explaining what different menu items were.  We left full and happy with this place.  I've been several times and always have a great experience.  Their food is great and the prices are reasonable.  Happy to mark this as one of my favorites in the area.

I've been here twice now and I ordered the same dish each time. The seafood tostada is actually a seafood salad. You can choose different dressings, but the homemade jalapeno ranch dressing is creamy and not overly spicy. It's really good. Sour cream and chunky guacamole come on the side. The dish features a large crispy flour tortilla bowl with beans, lettuce, cheese, 4 large shrimp and a sauteed hot seafood mix consisting of green and red peppers, onions, octopus, scallops, shrimp, and I think I may have seen mussels, but I could be wrong. 

I asked for no peppers, but I was told they were in the mix and couldn't be taken out. I coukd tell they did their best not to give me many though. This time I only had 4. The last time there were more like 20. I would not have guessed it was a mix. A mix makes me think they were frozen previously. The peppers didn't look to me like they were previously frozen, so I guess it just will remain a mystery. Regardless, it's an excellent salad at a reasonable price and you have enough to share if you wanted to.

The thing that really wows me about this restaurant are the chairs. They're all hand painted and absolutely beautiful with scenes from Mexico. It adds a certain charm to the ambiance. The walls are brightly painted and it gives the bustling eatery a cheerful feel. 

Each time I've come with a party of 8 or more, and despite the menu saying they won't split checks, the attentive and friendly waitstaff absolutely do. We will absolutely be back.

My boyfriend and I have been her numerous times since it opened and we're always extremely happy with the food and service. Ivy was our server tonight and was very friendly and nice and our food was brought out right away. We always get the guacamole and chips as a starter, it's our favorite! So happy this place opened up down the street from where we live.
Amazing food! Loved the decor, chef made complimentary soup for everyone because it was cold. I'll be back!!

Finally tried this place, friendly staff and very clean and colorful decor. Huge menu to choose from the chips  and salsa were good I order a 2 item combo I felt like the food was lacking flavor. the waiter was good and attentive.  Definitely will give the place another try and order something else on the menu. I've been in Vegas 23 yrs. And it's always been hard to find a good Mexican restaurant!

I've been in this town for over 40 years, and have worked in a very popular Mexican restaurant in the good old days- and these days, there are still very very authentic great Mexican restaurants- with very affordable prices. I will tell you this- I tell it like it is- This Place is very colorful, and the atmosphere is nice, But I'm here to get also Value for My $$$'s  It is way overpriced- unless your a Tourist- and Locals are way to smart that have been here and know exactly where to go.  The size and portion was small.  The chips are served in a small bowl and you need to get it refilled constantly.  The large margarita Glass- normally as a Bartender we call it the Bolla Grande Glass- is so Thick and Heavy by weight, that a average size lady can not even hold that glass in her hand, and is an optical illusion, to make you think that your getting a lot of margarita in your glass.  I didn't even feel any tequila, so I guess it was all filled with sweet and sour, and a dash of triple sec and result =  Lemonade, and not a Margarita.  That's just too bad, NOT even a nitch of buzz.  I guess you need to buy  about 6 Margaritas times (X) $ 9.00 before you can feel the buzz of the tequila.    Oh well- for Suckers that's ok, not for me.   Suggestion;=  Lower the Prices-  change that thickness of the Glass of Margarita, to a normal Glass- where the Lady's can actually have an easy time to pick up the glass. bigger size chips basket, and  salsa,  The tortilla a little thicker, and bigger-  The portion  size larger.   Compared to other popular Mexican restaurants.  you could be in Jeopardy?    The Food was not bad? but overpriced..

Amazing favorite place to be ! Where do I start ?? The food ! The staff ! Management ! The cuteness of the restaurant . Such a family fun place to be any day of the week for breakfast or lunch and dinner . Everyone is just so friendly here. Food is so authentic and is one of the best I've ever had I highly recommend Fiesta Mexicana for all your drink and food pleasures! Love you guys

Good food, nice staff. I had the beef fajitas. Food was excellent exceptional. Wish they had coke instead of Pepsi. Decor is very festive and vibrant. Prices slightly on the high side, but portions are good. Would definitely consider this place again next time we are in the mood for Mexican.

Eh.... went here for lunch yesterday with my son and it was ok. Nothing great but at least they had great chips and salsa.
My son had a shredded beef "burrito" which looked like an enchilada. A flour tortilla lightly rolled with some shredded beef in it. The beef was ok but nothing amazing. I tried the chile relleno and it was good. But that tamal! Yuck! It was undercooked and just yuck. You can see in the pic how it was still doughy-like and undercooked. I took a bite of it and took the rest to my brothers house for his dog to eat. I hate wasting food. 
The staff seemed to be obsessed with cleaning booths for some weird reason. Like they were obsessing over some small water spot! Weird! About 5 employees got involved into that investigation, LOL! Needless to say, I'm pretty sad that this place is here, I wish it was the previous Mexican restaurant it used to be:( or at least comparable. Glad I got to try their food at their lunch special prices because I'd be pretty disappointed paying their dinner menu prices!

Pros: Decor was awesome. Staff was friendly. Salsa was good.

Cons: Staff was inattentive. Errors in order. Ground beef was... Idk, strange.

We loved the decor as we came in, and did ask for a nearby table since my Grandmother has trouble walking. But we didn't mean in a unmanned section, just not in the gurthest booth. So we had very bad service. Though our server, Alan, was a very nice and friendly person, he wasn't a good server. We waited 5 minutes plus for water and chips and salsa and told him we were ready to order. He said he had to deliver another tables chips and salsa and he'd be right back. That took well over another 5 minutes. The food came quick enough and we requested extra salsa, he said he'd be right back, and never came. We had to get up and ask someone to get him twice for refills. But he never came to check on us without us sending people for him. By the time he did come we were almost done. My shredded beef enchilada had been a ground beef, which I certainly don't prefer, but normally would just deal. But the ground beef was strange, minced maybe? And watery? Like when I worked at Del Taco and the ground beef bag got water in it. Eventually we complained, which we honestly NEVER do. The manager was sexy, so that was nice, and he was apologetic and offered free dessert, but we declined. We didn't want free stuff just a nice meal out. I chose the restaurant based on it's good reviews so I feel like I have to offset that based on the experience. It wasn't cheap, and wasn't worth it. That salsa was great though. And my moms Burrito Mexicana with three sauces was very good.

First time here and I really enjoyed this place. Great food, atmosphere, and staff. I had the enchiladas de mole, and was very impressed. Be perfect blend of sweet without going overboard. House margaritas were ok, I've had better, but would return for them specifically just because of the staff and atmosphere. Would recommend for those who like traditional northern Mexican food.

Amazing! Our new go to restaurant. Ignacio is a fantastic server. So cute and funny. truly enjoyed the atmosphere and attention we got from all the staff. Food was SOOOOOO good. Large servings and fresh.
Ordered the cadillac margarita... they pour the tall shot of Grand Marnier into the mix at the table so you know what you are getting. Prices are competitive. Food and service outstanding.

This place is nice and clean the good is great. It's a place to come and have great food and drinks with your friends and family. They have happy Maragarita  on Monday-thursday  from 2pm to 6pm and late happy hour from 9pm to close.
Service has always been bad in the afternoons. Customer service needs improvement. Not sure if I would go back again. Plate hot food cold.

My co-workers and I have had lunch at Fiesta several times.  The salsa has a nice bite of spice to it, and it is obviously freshly made.  They have a secret habanero version you can ask for that is fruity and not insanely hot too.

We have enjoyed each meal we have had.  Good, solid Mexican food at a reasonable price for lunch.

The dining room is cheerful and very clean.  We have had goid service from various staff.

This location is cursed.  We hope Fiesta will stay around for a long time.

Came here last night for dinner with my mom and we really enjoyed ourselves. Each got a 3 choice combo with a variety of items and all so very delicious. This place is so cute and I couldn't get over how nice it is inside with a variety of booths and tables with very colorful cheerful decor. The man who seated us was very pleasant and our server Pablo was excellent. Everyone seemed so nice and friendly. Amazing food and service...we will definitely be back!
Longest wait i have ever waited food was cold and very salty I would never come back to this place again

We stopped by around 11:30am on a Friday and it was fairly empty. We were seated right away and we were happy with how spacious the booths were! Two adults and two purses were comfortable on one side. The chips and salsa were brought out promptly and they were delicious! The three of us probably waited 30 min or so for our food and all we got were two chicken quesadillas and a chicken burrito. We thought the wait was long for an empty restaurant but the food was very very good. I got a chicken quesadilla with a side of rice and pico de gallo and a drink and my total was $18.90. I thought it was a little pricey but I mainly think that was due to the side of rice being overpriced. Overall good restaurant, but watch your sides or your bill will shoot up.
Very good food and service. I liked the beans which says a lot. Super burrito was big. Lunch specials are large and reasonably priced. Definitely will come back
Fun atmosphere and decor, great staff, service was excellent, food was delicious! And my husband is very picky with his Mexican food! The fried ice cream was amazing!!!

This place was very clean , and the service was on point! 
We had a great experience. 
Someone had a birthday next to us and we were so amazed how the crowd around us got involved and stated clapping along  I think I want to go for one of our birthdays 
Our food all came out so good I really don't have any complaints. Even at one point my tortillas got a little cold and out waiter offered to take it back and warm them up  cheers to that guy !

New Mexican restaurant in town and it is the Bomb as they say . The food was incredible our waiter was fantastic. Fiesta Mexicana is going to be the place for Mexican food. The Decour is so cute makes the meal even more enjoyable. The chips and salsa was one of our favorite things We will be back soon..
These people put a lot effort into everything they do--Great food, great service, great atmosphere, and great music.  I will definitely frequent this fine establishment.

Been looking for a go to Mexican Restaurant and this is it! Decor was lots of fun, which is just about the lowest thing on my priority list. 

Service for our group of 9 was just impeccable. We all arrived at different times and our waiter, Jesus, was right there to get drink orders. He kept it all straight and all 4 bills were absolutely correct. Food was deluvered promptly and accurately. Water glasses were kept full as well as sodas and Margaritas.

The food, always my TOP priority,  was darn good. I ordered the burrito Alcapulco which was 1) way more than i could possibly eat; 2) absolutely delicious. It was chopped seafood inside a large burrito with a light sauce that didn't overwhelm the seafood flavor. So good! Hubby had taco salad with shredded chicken...it was excellent. Others had happy hour quesadillas, nachos and taquitoes. All loved their food...highly unusual!!

Jesus, it was a pleasure meeting you and we look forward to our next visit.

For a NEW restaurant they are very disorganized. We dine early and prefer to sit in the bar. Service left a LOT to be desired. We got chips & salsa right away and then were totally ignored until the bartender noticed we weren't being served at all. There were plenty of employees there but mostly just standing around. 
The food was pretty average & nothing special. Prices were comparable. For a chain restaurant we were not impressed. This was our 2nd visit cause we live nearby - won't be back. Wish them the best!
Excellent food, drinks and service! Lively decor. Have yet to be disappointed at Fiesta Mexicana.

Liliana , Liliana, Liliana my server today for lunch was very professional and kind, omg she is very kind an smart to take our orders , she recited the whole menu but we ar LATINOS!! Looking for AGUACHILES to get rid of the hangover from last night, anyway our food was delicious like the time before i vicit this place!!! Just a tip those michelada preparadas ar jus water with juice, terrible prep, looks good in a big glass but just water!!! MICHELADA IS A MICHELADA NO MAMENNNNMNNNN, Lol. Atmosphere is very nice and peaceful, very clean restaurant!! Bathrooms are immaculate and spotless!! Parking right in the door so you can watch your car from the windows . Liliana the best of best!!! The other servers around should smile a lil more. Just sayin. I will comeback and bring the whole crew for the happy hour.
Really! Which other place gives U ur OWN PLATE W FULL SIDES 4 each individual when u r suppose 2 share?!?!?!NO EXTRA COST?!?!?!YUMMY!!!!

First visit here and we had an amazing experience. Once you've had Mexican food in Mexico it's hard to really describe the restaurants in the U.S. as authentic, however we did enjoy the food and experience. Decor is cheesy but cute. 

Service 
Staff was very friendly and attentive and we were very happy with the service provided.

Drinks
Delicious margaritas that come in different flavors. We ordered the original and it comes with a side of sweet tequila shots...omg...amazing!!! 

Food
We started with flour chips and guacamole. Have never had flour chips before and I couldn't put them down even though I'm trying to limit my carb intake. It was sooooo good and melted in your mouth like butter. I want to go back just for those chips.

Portion sides are humongous. I ordered the shrimp tacos and didn't realize it came with beans and rice. It was delicious and the rice was well season and very good. 

Both of my friends enjoyed their meals as well. Overall I would definitely come back here.

This place is amazing!!! The best Mexican food I've had in so long! Live music, great atmosphere and our server Ivy was amazing as well! Thanks Ivy we'll be seeing you again very soon! Oh and great margaritas as well...
If your in vegas and want real authentic mexican food this place is a must and food and drinks are amazing
Firat time here!! It was great!! As soon as we walked in we were greeted nicely. Everyone was super friendly!! Food was great and worth every cent!!

One of the BEST place to drink and eat. Nice
Waiters and servers. Very comfortable environment.

We had been excited to try out Fiesta Mexicana, and we finally had a chance! First of all the restaurant is absolutely stunning! Their hand painted booths, tables, chairs, and benches are beautiful!

Now onto the stuff that matters: food! Delicious food! I had the chicken enchiladas en mole, and they were amazing! Everyone I was with enjoyed their meals. The portions are very generous too!

I also had a michelada which was really good too! And the cucumber margarita is a must try too!

Their service was amazing! Our server -- who I unfortunately cannot remember her name -- was so attentive! Everyone was so amiable and pleasant! Plus they had live music! Always a plus!

This will definitely not be the last time we go!

Don't know if the food is any good. We never had a chance to eat. I understand that the place is new, but when the server returns to your table four times in 15 minutes to confirm your order, that is not a good sign. We put in our order 10 minutes before 3 (the designated cutoff for lunch) and she returns to tell us I cannot have the lunch special because it's after 3, but the rest of the order has been put in. She then returns another five minutes later to to tell us that my wife's lunch (which is also on the lunch menu) is also not available because it is after 3. This is about 15 minutes after we put our order in. We then decided to leave. My wife is an insulin dependant diabetic and she was less than happy with the situation. On the way out, the hostess said "Have a nice day". Salsa is pretty tasty though. 2 stars for that.

Came here tonight to visit with family that I have not seen in many many years,  some for the first time.  Okay,  I will admit that we did this on a Tuesday evening so there is that BUT...

Got here about 6:30 and I guess this was their busy hour because there were about maybe 8 table filled with plenty of walking room through the aisles and sparse enough to not have to yell.  A little concerning but maybe this a place more to come on holidays.  I ordered a camarones plate with an average amount of prawns but the really nice thing was the amount of mushrooms which were not spared in any way.  Good amount of rice and beans to make it a full meal.  Not too expensive as some places can be in Vegas that can be overpriced and overhyped.  Service was actually great because it was slow so anytime we needed anything,  just getting the server's attention was the only real issue.  May come back in time,  we shall see but for what it was,  not bad at all.
It was pretty great! Very polite and very attentive. A little too attentive but I mean it was slow so it was good and the little flags with the food are just adorable

Finally its a miracle!  Move over Michoacans, Lindos, Ricardos, DonJuans etc,  We finally have a real MEXICAN (abeit American-Mexican) Restaurant in LAS VEGAS. Thank You God. This will save me hundreds flying to El Paso or LA  to eat Mexican food in a restaurant. Other than the Mexican grocery stores, this is the real deal. Great REAL food, awesome service, incredible artwork and decor, top notch drinks all affordable on our working-poor wage. Get there now and you'll never waste a fortune at those expensive fakes again.

First time eating here and definitely not our last!  Great variety and good flavor. It was worth the extra miles for us to eat here.  Our waitress Ivy was super, refilling beverages quickly because she was attentive.

Jesus took very good care of us the moment we walked in. I got a tasty Horchata to drink and I ordered the Fiesta Camarones. Basically bacon wrapped shrimps over fajita veggies and covered in melted cheese. Sides of refried beans and delicious rice accompanied with a bit of lettuce, pico de Gallo, and guacamole. I put my bacon shrimps in a flour tortilla and topped with everything else and it was amazing. We also got cheese enchiladas which were a dollar for taco Tuesday and the enchiladas sauce is absolutely tasty. My friends got the Al Pastor tacos and gave me one and they were also quite nice. We shared a mixto ceviche which had abalone shrimp octopus with some tostada's. Dashed it with the tapatio and it was perfect. Tender seafood and a nice zing with the lemon juice and hot sauce. Overall very enjoyable. Will be back for taco Tuesday for the enchiladas.

We have been there 4 times now, and the first time was just as they were opening. I must admit the first meal was good. The second time we had tacos with very little meat in them. The second time we ordered Carnitas, and there was not much meat compared to other Mexican restaurants in Las Vegas. The carnitas was dry and not very flavorful. The last  meal was the same item I purchased in the first meal.It not contained less than half the meat as the first one and really over sauced. The service was fine. Seems to be on a downward trend. Really disappointed.
Went here yesterday, service was slow, saw our waiter maybe twice. Food reminded me of frozen Mexican food. All in all was disappointed. Next time I'll go to robertos and save some money.

Definitely deserving of a 5 start rating. This place is beautiful with excellent service and an impressive menu! 
I'm happy. I really wanted to love this place because it's so close to home. 
I'm from Cali and know my Mexican and am located within Asian cuisine. Now if you know me you know my favorite is Asian cuisine so I'm not complaining on that part but it lacks for other taste. I'm happy to find a full Mexican restaurant near me!
The meal was very good! Salas is delicious and chips are freshly made. I love how colorful this place is with beautiful murals everywhere! 
I had the polo de creme and he ordered burrito Verde. Both are excellent and I recommend both! Our waiter was a doll! Great service and definitely will be returning!
Happy hour Monday-Thursday 2pm-6pm and 9pm-close.

Fiesta Mexicana Las Vegas is a Americanized Mexican restaurant chain with one location here in Las Vegas. In my opinion, it is no bueno.

I wasn't really impressed with the food after my first visit to Fiesta Mexicana, but thought I'd wait to try more of the menu before posting a not-so-great review. After a second visit for lunch with 6 co-workers the consensus is that there will be no future visits. 

Service, while friendly, was so slow. Our waitress took our drink orders and then disappeared for what felt like an eternity. Over 20 minutes passed before our drinks were actually brought out; it took so long that we actually received a refills of the complimentary chips and salsa before we had our beverages, only one of which required much effort (a mojito, 5 beers and an iced tea). We had to ask for waters as well. 

I can overlook slow service if the food is exceptional. and I have not been impressed with anything I have had at Fiesta Mexicana. The salsa is ok, nothing to write home about but acceptable for complimentary salsa. The flautas were disappointing, as was the carne asada burrito. Portions are large, but the flavors are lacking for the prices being charged. 

There are numerous places in the general area I'd pick over Fiesta Mexicana for Mexican food.

Yelp Reviews 2018 16/100
The food is delicous. The waitress was very polite. The place is clean. Very traditional. & the decoration is beyond expectation. Everything inside says MEXICO!!!

This place is great.  I have been here four times now since I have discovered it and have tried a variety of the menu items.

Let's talk a biggie item of importance first - the chips and salsa!  Excellent chips and salsa with just the right amount of kick.  Some of the better chips and salsa here in my opinion.  


Next, the food.  I have had chicken a variety of ways here - chimis, chalupa, sopito - all use the same shredded chicken mix which you can actually taste the seasoning in (which is tasty). In addition, I have had chicken mole enchiladas (not my favorite here). Also, I have had a couple of shrimp items.  One was wrapped in bacon (good) and the other with mushrooms (very tasty - but had to pick up shrimp with garlic sauce with my hands and finish peeling them).  This is the best thing I have had here so far but I also had something different, a crispy fried chile relleno. It's almost like a wonton. It was different and I am pretty sure I liked it!  It got soggy fast but had I gotten to it earlier, it would have maintained its crispness and that's what was nice about it. So, overall - I like the food. 

The staff is always very friendly and attentive. And the place is "festive" on decor (like the name) providing a nice atmosphere.

I really enjoy this place and have it in my rotation of regulars

Had lunch here today as I had a business consulting meeting. I wasn't planing on lunch but i figured I'd give it a try. I was very impressed with how great the food tasted. For $9.99 I was served a steak chimichanga , a chicken enchilada w rice and beans. Piping hot and fresh. Full of flavor. The waitress was super nice. Very clean facility and great decor. The only thing i would recommend is bringing the AC a little colder as it was pretty hot in there (granted its 110 degrees outside). Overall great experience w a great price!!!
Great food. The server took forever to get drinks and also did not bring enough napkins for the party of 3. The horchata drink ( rice milk.) had a funny taste to it. Other than that good food.
This was wonderful food and the service was great! :) I would eat here again in a heart beat!

I love this place !  From the smiling face that greets you at the front door to the folks that bring endless chips and salsa to the very outstanding wait staff ! But the best part is the FOOD !  Chile Verde is My Favorite ...

This place is great. Food is amazing quality and service is even better. You can't beat the prices. 
Happy hour is Mon-Thur 2pm-5pm and 9pm-close. 
We love this place and eat here at least twice a week.

I really enjoyed the food here, good portions! My gf and I can smash and one meal was enough for us to share. We also had a beer and a margarita (delicious!) that I thought were fairly priced. One of my favorite Mexican restaurants I've found in Vegas yet
Yaaaaassssss it was my first time here and it was amazing. I tried the cucumber margarita and it was fabulous best ever. There food was amazing as well I will definitely be back.

First time in. Amazing hospitality. Enjoyed the atmosphere and scenery in this elegant restaurant here in Spring Valley area. Alfredo was our server and deserved a 5 Star rating! Thank you Mi Nuevo Familia. Gracias Por Todo.

I'm excited this place opened here in Las Vegas having read good reviews at their other locations out of state. The server was extremely friendly and personable. 

The salsa is very flavorful and has a good kick of heat. I also ordered the guacamole served with fried tortilla chips. Good, but I wish it more of an avocado flavor. 

The seafood tostado was top notch. The octopus was cooked well and tender. My desert was a margarita. It had a good balance of tequila and not too sweet with sweet and sour. 

I will return!

I typically don't like to leave 5 star reviews since I'm not usually a believer of a restaurant being completely on point, but man, this place really was awesome! Once you walk in the ambiance makes you feel like you're in Mexico. It's bright, colorful and there's tons of artwork. My bae and I came for a late Saturday night dinner around 8pm so we were quickly able to be seated. 

I started off my meal with a cadillac margarita. That bad boy was HUGE & delicious. I definitely got a good buzz going from just one. Next was the complementary chips & salsa. I always judge a Mexican restaurant by their salsa and theirs was very good. They had two types, both seemed medium in heat to me & both were very tasty. For an entree I had the shrimp enchiladas. I love everything about them.. the sauce, the rice, the beans.. ughhh ALL of it. I also loved the amount of seafood they had on their menu. Being a pescatarian, their menu was heaven to me. The prices were a bit higher compared to other Mexican restaurants around the valley, but the quality shows. 

To top thing off our server was very attentive and friendly. We didn't have any complaints on anything. I will 100% be back here again. This would be an awesome place for a fun birthday dinner!

My Favorite Mexican place in town, the pina coladas are great! Food is great with humongous portions, price is reasonable. They have mariachi's at times. Between their decor and food, it is the closest thing to going to mexico. I had their specialty pork carnitas and their shrimps look really good, for sure next time, since I will be coming back and bringing more people with me.

We have been coming here at least once a month since they opened last summer.  So happy to have a great sit-down Mexican restaurant in this neighborhood.  Yes, it's Americanized, but I'm American and I like my tacos with cheese, lettuce, tomato and sour cream.  I think that's the best way to eat 'em up.     Many people judge Mexican restaurants by the chips & salsa, and I'm no different.  The house salsa is great.  It's medium spicy and has chunks of tomato, cilantro and scallions.  Ask for the habanero salsa and they'll happily bring a green style salsa that is really tasty with sliced scallions, garlic, and habaneros.  Yes, that one time, the chips weren't hot off the fryer, but they were still good chips and nothing to complain about.       The wife and I request to sit in the little booths adjacent to the bar.  The service has always been fast, attentive and friendly.  We enjoy the Cadillac Margaritas and the bartender always puts them together quickly.  The portions are large and we always need a to-go box if two entrees are ordered.  Lately, for a weekend lunch, we'll split the sampler platter from the appetizer menu, have a couple margaritas, and it's perfect.       On a side note, I used to visit the Page, AZ location on trips to Lake Powell back in the mid-2000's.  We always looked forward to stopping there after the 4-hour drive from Vegas.  The food at that location is great and the place is always packed in the summer.  I was so happy to see that they finally expanded close to home.
Forgot my picture of OUR dessert..AMAZING!!  Continued from 1st post..  You HAVE to see in inside of the restaurant!  Full of great items!

This place is hands-down the best Mexican food I've had since living in Las Vegas. You get really big portions at a really good price. I had an enchilada style burrito which was absolutely amazing. I also had a michelada that was beyond perfect. Lastly, our server Jesus was the most polite, hospitable and humble waiter I've ever experienced.  Hands down WILL be back and if you decide to eat at this facility, mark my words you will NOT be disappointed.

This place has awesome service a-mazing food and decent prices. I love their mole and chili verde they are huge portions and are not expensive at all. It's very family friendly there too..I eat a lot of Mexican food and this place is my favorite in Las Vegas even compared to Javier's or bonito Michoac√°n. I highly recommend them

Been eye this place for sometime now and about a few weeks decided to try it out.

I will I was not dissapointed  and meal was great and large portion that I even took some home and enjoyed it for dinner. 

I had the Chili Verde and it was delicious.
Flavors  where not spicy but just right.

My wife had the a burrito and that also was a large portion.

Tried the magaraitas and try hit the spot.

The service was great we got greeted at the door by Joselin  and we got walked to our table by her,  our server Ivy came right away and took our drinks gave us a few minutes to look over our menu... came about 6-8 mins after took our order and our food was fantastic very delicious. Ivy checked on is every 8-10 mins to make sure we put cups were filled ... first time and for sure not the last time ... Allen the manager was very nice as well making sure everything was good !!

Nope. First time i went it was when they first opened and they weren't crazy busy so i received good service, 2nd time was the worst. Was seated and waited 5 minutes for our server but for him to bring our drinks took what seemed a good 15 minutes! He would walk past our table and would see we were ready to order and would just ignore us! After we finally ordered i asked for more water for everyone and (i actually timed it) 23 minutes later i had to ask a different waiter for water. Would pick the iHop that's next to it before i come here again.

UH MAZING!  Out here in Vegas for a tournament and so happy to find this gem!  After shopping at the local Walmart we were starved.  I had the combo chili relleno plate and my lil one had the chimichanga plate.  The photos of the plates looked super huge and to our surprise, the plates and portions were larger and were as delicious as they looked.   Great food find for a place so far away from home. 

Our waitress Liliana kept coming by to make sure we were okay and if we needed anything else since the food came out so quickly.  The server Enrique was very welcoming and greeted us the moment we sat down.  He was very upbeat and made sure our water was topped off. 

We will definitely be back to this family restaurant.  The paintings on the chairs and decor is awesome.  

You gotta check out the plates on the walls!!  You'll be like "wowe"!!!!!

Mexican Party is pretty good. The decor and atmosphere is very fun and family friendly. The plastic flags were disappointing but didn't outshine from the stellar service we received. Very nice and helpful staff.  The food was what I would expect it to be.  It was good hot and came out quickly. Very fair pricing and we'll be back.
Excellent Service! Tasty Food & Margherita's. Ordered the Fiesta Enchiladas which were very good. The plates are huge with a side of beans, rice and quacamole. Definitely will be back!
My new favorite spot close to home. Colorful and positive vibe inside the Resturant with a happy staff. So happy this place opened up. Thank you

Good is ok , posole tasted like fish soap. My wife's steak had no flavor .. service was good and friendly ... this restaurant better get a new chef or it's going out of business .: I don't mind paying but the quality of the food is not worth the menu price.. oh it also says home made tortilla but they taste like if they came out of the bag ..

This was our very 1st visit here...
I am a Mexican food snob! We drove up...to be perfectly honest we were thinking oh no...a white person Mexican restaurant! Now those of you who know Mexican and I mean real Mexican know that if you see a lot of white people walk out or are sitting down eating that it is probably very bland...very americanized! If you see mexican people at a Mexican restaurant, Italians at an Italian restaurant, Asians at an Asian restaurant...you know it will be good... we have turned and walked away from places that have had only white people eating in them...but I kept seeing such great reviews on Facebook about this place and we drove 30 minutes to get there...I thought we better try! 
So glad we did. We walked up to a very well decorated building, great atmosphere, mexican music playing on the speakers. We were greeted and sat immediately. Another waiter came and delivered chips and salsa and as soon as he walked away another one asked us what we would like to drink.
The chips were fresh...the salsa even fresher. Great flavor...not spicy..but full of flavor.
We ordered the chili con queso as a starter...warm delicious cheese, Ortega chilis...served with flour tortilla chips. Yum does not even cover how great it was. The cheese was so creamy and spiced just right and Noone serves flour tortilla chips anymore! 
The waiter was super attentive, asked if we had any questions, was very friendly and fun. We finally decided what we were going to have...it took me a very long time because so many things looked yummy. My man decided to have the chilie verde and I had a shredded beef buritto. 
The chilie verde was packed full of flavor. You could see that the chilies were toasted by the blackness in the sauce. It was spicy but not to the point it was unbearable. It had a Mexican slaw on the top that my man said was super tasty. The rice and beans were really good. Beans were creamy but still had some solid beans. Mexican restaurants for me have to have 4 good things...chips and salsa...and beans and rice! If they pass that then the rest will hopefully match up! My shredded beef buritto was packed full of tasty meat, very authentic. Wasnt packed full of filler like peppers and onions. The meat was tender and juicy!!! 
I have to say that we really enjoyed ourselves...not just with the food, but the atmosphere, the music and the staff. We will definitely be back!

First time visit and I must say that the service that ELPIDIO gave us was amazing, from the moment we sat down to the moment that we got up to leave! & the food is amazing ! Definitelywill be seeing me here a lot more often.

Based on a review from a family member we decided to give this place a shot! We were seated right away. The menu is expansive! They have a lot of items, so be ready to read! (I must confess, I love that dessert was on the first page!) We started off with a lava colada & the server brought us chips & salsa - unless you enjoy sweating out of your eyeballs, make sure you ask for the mild salsa. Sweet mother that was spicy!   Our waiter, Elpidio, was fabulous! He was patient as we checked over the menu and even warned us that the kitchen might be a little slow due to large (obnoxious) parties in the restaurant. We ordered a three item combo to split, shredded beef chimi, shredded chicken chimi, shredded beef chalupa with beans and rice. Everything came out hot and steamy. It was delicious!!! The beef was tender and juicy and had such wonderful flavor. The chicken didn't have the same spice as the beef and STILL tasted amazing! The beans and rice were good. The atmosphere is fun. Lots of TVs showing sports: soccer & basketball & ESPN.  There's a bar area as well. We will definitely be back and next time I'm trying the fried ice cream!

Called to place an order and was put on hold by ALEJANDRA but I guess they don't know how to use the hold bottom. While I waited,on "hold", I could here them arguing about who was going to take the order and they were cursing, I hung up and called again. Same person answered, Alejandra, and she still  hadn't figured out who could place an order finally they hand the phone over to another guy that took my order although polite he had no clue what he was doing.....  maybe that's why the place looks always empty. I will follow up with the taste of the food to see if they can redeem themselves.

Fiesta is most festive when you walk in.  They have a very large menu that covers all you could ever ask for.  The food was quite good as this is what we call americanized mexican food.  They day we visited they had $1.99 margaritas all day and they were very good.  Service was top notch. We will come back here again.

Loved it! It looked like a Mexican place we eat at in moab, and the hostess confirmed that is one of their locations. They had just opened their business a few days before.  We just happened to be driving and saw this extremely colorful building! The inside is just as colorful ha ha ha! It's very Mexican gone overboard just like in Moab. The waiter was extremely friendly! And I swear it was the strongest margarita I've ever had-yum! And came with a shot of tequila. I ordered the molcajete like the one I had in Moab, I wish it had more shrimp in it-but it was so good for 2 people! Great service, friendly staff and good food :)

My criteria for rating a Mexican restaurant goes like this:

Chips and Salsa: Excellent! Crispy, thin chips and three salsas to choose from. 

Liquor: Good. Small assortment of Mexican beers on tap, including Pacifico. 20 oz. came in a big frosty cup for $6.25. Milady had a mango margarita, which was very tasty. Probably could have used more tequila, but good nonetheless.

Food: Good. I had a combo with a crispy chile relleno (excellent), burrito and chimi. Milady had tacos al carbon, which were very tasty. Combo was $14, tacos were $16. Taco plate probably should be closer to $12, but good nonetheless.

Decor: excellent! Beautiful furniture and decor. Clean, clean, clean!! TV's everywhere and a really nice, cozy bar area.

Staff: Excellent! Everyone we dealt with was helpful and nice. We went on Saturday at around 8, so it was not too busy. Might have had something to do with the impeccable service, but I think Jesus is one helluva server. 

We will go back. As for price and quality of food, this place stands up to any Lindo restaurant in town.
Absolutely great chile verde wet burrito..$11.99..very nice decor. Service top notch..well be back to try the rest of the rather large menu
Wow they called it enchiladas this is more like a burrito size.. food is the biggest portion ever great place to bring the whole family.. this is by far the best deep fried ice cream ever

Excellent food and the service was outstanding! Started off with bomb chips n salsa and a killer peach margarita.  The plates were all so good with killer frijoles. My sister said chili verde was the best in town . Our waiter David was so nice. Definitely will be a regular dining spot for us

I have been looking for good Mexican since I moved here...and finally found it! Not only was everything fresh and tasty....the atmosphere is nice a mellow.
Mariachi walking around playing...but not overwhelming.  Decor is really cute...and the kicker....exceptionally clean and all the staff friendly 
I will be a regular here!
